result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Bail applied - Balance due $0 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Counseling for domestic violence, anger management.
No violent contact with C.V. - victim.
Defendant to submit DNA sample.
Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J Simpson

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan J Simpson in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court. Counsel addresses non-appearance of defendant. Court, warrant was stayed until today. State requests warrant be stayed and tight turnaround for next date. Court, warrant will issue on next date if defendant does not appear in person.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No authorization on file. Def does live out of state.   Court orders bench warrant, held to next courtdate. If defendant fails to appear warrant will be issued.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Conditions set by court:no violent contact with victim in complaint,  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

Defendant Ryan J Simpson in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received copy of complaint, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Atty Perez Reyes from SPD emailed clerk informing def does qualify for our services, however, he is working a construction job in Missouri and has a work/transportation conflict for the June 4th date and requests adjournment to July. No objection from the state.
